alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 17 at 3:09PM MDT until June 19 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ..Scattered thunderstorms will develop in northeast Colorado this afternoon and move into the remainder of the area this evening. Due to heavy rainfall last night, areas along and south of Interstate 70 will be susceptible to additional flooding as these storms move through. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... The Flood Watch continues for * A portion of east central Colorado, including the following areas, Cheyenne and Kit Carson. * Until midnight MDT tonight * WHEN...From this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
